speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Bardolph, am I not fallen away vilely since

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: this last action? Do I not bate? Do I not dwindle?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why, my skin hangs about me like an old lady’s

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: loose gown. I am withered like an old applejohn.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Well, I’ll repent, and that suddenly, while I am in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: some liking. I shall be out of heart shortly, and then

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I shall have no strength to repent. An I have not

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: forgotten what the inside of a church is made of, I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: am a peppercorn, a brewer’s horse. The inside of a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: church! Company, villainous company, hath been

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the spoil of me.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Sir John, you are so fretful you cannot live

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: long.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why, there is it. Come, sing me a bawdy

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: song, make me merry. I was as virtuously given as a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: gentleman need to be, virtuous enough: swore

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: little; diced not above seven times—a week; went to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: a bawdy house not above once in a quarter—of an

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: hour; paid money that I borrowed—three or four

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: times; lived well and in good compass; and now I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: live out of all order, out of all compass.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Why, you are so fat, Sir John, that you must

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: needs be out of all compass, out of all reasonable

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: compass, Sir John.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Do thou amend thy face, and I’ll amend my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: life. Thou art our admiral, thou bearest the lantern

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: in the poop, but ’tis in the nose of thee. Thou art the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Knight of the Burning Lamp.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Why, Sir John, my face does you no harm.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: No, I’ll be sworn, I make as good use of it as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: many a man doth of a death’s-head or a memento

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: mori. I never see thy face but I think upon hellfire

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: and Dives that lived in purple, for there he is in his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: robes, burning, burning. If thou wert any way given

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: to virtue, I would swear by thy face. My oath should

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: be “By this fire, that’s God’s angel.” But thou art

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: altogether given over, and wert indeed, but for the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: light in thy face, the son of utter darkness. When

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thou ran’st up Gad’s Hill in the night to catch my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: horse, if I did not think thou hadst been an ignis

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fatuus, or a ball of wildfire, there’s no purchase in

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: money. O, thou art a perpetual triumph, an everlasting

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bonfire-light. Thou hast saved me a thousand

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: marks in links and torches, walking with thee in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: night betwixt tavern and tavern, but the sack that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thou hast drunk me would have bought me lights as

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: good cheap at the dearest chandler’s in Europe. I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: have maintained that salamander of yours with fire

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: any time this two-and-thirty years, God reward me

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: for it.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: ’Sblood, I would my face were in your

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: belly!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Godamercy, so should I be sure to be

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: heartburned!

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How now, Dame Partlet the hen, have you enquired

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: yet who picked my pocket?

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Why, Sir John, what do you think, Sir John,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: do you think I keep thieves in my house? I have

speaker: HOSTESS
text: searched, I have enquired, so has my husband,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: man by man, boy by boy, servant by servant.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: The tithe of a hair was never lost in my house

speaker: HOSTESS
text: before.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: You lie, hostess. Bardolph was shaved and

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: lost many a hair, and I’ll be sworn my pocket was

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: picked. Go to, you are a woman, go.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Who, I? No, I defy thee! God’s light, I was

speaker: HOSTESS
text: never called so in mine own house before.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Go to, I know you well enough.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: No, Sir John, you do not know me, Sir John. I

speaker: HOSTESS
text: know you, Sir John. You owe me money, Sir John,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: and now you pick a quarrel to beguile me of it. I

speaker: HOSTESS
text: bought you a dozen of shirts to your back.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dowlas, filthy dowlas. I have given them

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: away to bakers’ wives; they have made bolters of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: them.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Now, as I am a true woman, holland of eight

speaker: HOSTESS
text: shillings an ell. You owe money here besides, Sir

speaker: HOSTESS
text: John, for your diet and by-drinkings and money

speaker: HOSTESS
text: lent you, four-and-twenty pound.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: He had his part of it.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Let him pay.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: He? Alas, he is poor. He hath nothing.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How, poor? Look upon his face. What call

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: you rich? Let them coin his nose. Let them coin his

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cheeks. I’ll not pay a denier. What, will you make a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: younker of me? Shall I not take mine ease in mine

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: inn but I shall have my pocket picked? I have lost a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: seal ring of my grandfather’s worth forty mark.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: O Jesu, I have heard the Prince

speaker: HOSTESS
text: tell him, I know not how oft, that that ring was

speaker: HOSTESS
text: copper.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How? The Prince is a jack, a sneak-up.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: ’Sblood, an he were here, I would cudgel him like a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: dog if he would say so.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: How now, lad, is the wind in that door, i’ faith? Must

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: we all march?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Yea, two and two, Newgate fashion.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: My lord, I pray you, hear me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What say’st thou, Mistress Quickly? How doth

speaker: PRINCE
text: thy husband? I love him well; he is an honest man.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Good my lord, hear me.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Prithee, let her alone, and list to me.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What say’st thou, Jack?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The other night I fell asleep here, behind the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: arras, and had my pocket picked. This house is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: turned bawdy house; they pick pockets.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What didst thou lose, Jack?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Wilt thou believe me, Hal, three or four

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: bonds of forty pound apiece, and a seal ring of my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: grandfather’s.

speaker: PRINCE
text: A trifle, some eightpenny matter.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: So I told him, my lord, and I said I heard

speaker: HOSTESS
text: your Grace say so. And, my lord, he speaks most

speaker: HOSTESS
text: vilely of you, like a foul-mouthed man, as he is, and

speaker: HOSTESS
text: said he would cudgel you.

speaker: PRINCE
text: What, he did not!

speaker: HOSTESS
text: There’s neither faith, truth, nor womanhood

speaker: HOSTESS
text: in me else.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: There’s no more faith in thee than in a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: stewed prune, nor no more truth in thee than in a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: drawn fox, and for womanhood, Maid Marian may

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: be the deputy’s wife of the ward to thee. Go, you

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: thing, go.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Say, what thing, what thing?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What thing? Why, a thing to thank God on.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: I am no thing to thank God on, I would thou

speaker: HOSTESS
text: shouldst know it! I am an honest man’s wife, and,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: setting thy knighthood aside, thou art a knave to

speaker: HOSTESS
text: call me so.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Setting thy womanhood aside, thou art a

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: beast to say otherwise.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Say, what beast, thou knave, thou?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: What beast? Why, an otter.

speaker: PRINCE
text: An otter, Sir John. Why an otter?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why, she’s neither fish nor flesh; a man

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: knows not where to have her.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Thou art an unjust man in saying so. Thou or

speaker: HOSTESS
text: any man knows where to have me, thou knave,

speaker: HOSTESS
text: thou.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Thou sayst true, hostess, and he slanders thee

speaker: PRINCE
text: most grossly.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: So he doth you, my lord, and said this other

speaker: HOSTESS
text: day you owed him a thousand pound.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Sirrah, do I owe you a thousand pound?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: A thousand pound, Hal? A million. Thy love is

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: worth a million; thou owest me thy love.

speaker: HOSTESS
text: Nay, my lord, he called you “jack,” and said

speaker: HOSTESS
text: he would cudgel you.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Did I, Bardolph?

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Indeed, Sir John, you said so.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Yea, if he said my ring was copper.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I say ’tis copper. Darest thou be as good as thy

speaker: PRINCE
text: word now?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Why, Hal, thou knowest, as thou art but

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: man, I dare, but as thou art prince, I fear thee as I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: fear the roaring of the lion’s whelp.

speaker: PRINCE
text: And why not as the lion?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: The King himself is to be feared as the lion.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dost thou think I’ll fear thee as I fear thy father?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Nay, an I do, I pray God my girdle break.

speaker: PRINCE
text: O, if it should, how would thy guts fall about

speaker: PRINCE
text: thy knees! But, sirrah, there’s no room for faith,

speaker: PRINCE
text: truth, nor honesty in this bosom of thine. It is all

speaker: PRINCE
text: filled up with guts and midriff. Charge an honest

speaker: PRINCE
text: woman with picking thy pocket? Why, thou whoreson,

speaker: PRINCE
text: impudent, embossed rascal, if there were

speaker: PRINCE
text: anything in thy pocket but tavern reckonings,

speaker: PRINCE
text: memorandums of bawdy houses, and one poor

speaker: PRINCE
text: pennyworth of sugar candy to make thee long-winded,

speaker: PRINCE
text: if thy pocket were enriched with any other

speaker: PRINCE
text: injuries but these, I am a villain. And yet you will

speaker: PRINCE
text: stand to it! You will not pocket up wrong! Art thou

speaker: PRINCE
text: not ashamed?

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Dost thou hear, Hal? Thou knowest in the

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: state of innocency Adam fell, and what should poor

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Jack Falstaff do in the days of villainy? Thou seest I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: have more flesh than another man and therefore

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: more frailty. You confess, then, you picked my

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: pocket.

speaker: PRINCE
text: It appears so by the story.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Hostess, I forgive thee. Go make ready

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: breakfast, love thy husband, look to thy servants,

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: cherish thy guests. Thou shalt find me tractable

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: to any honest reason. Thou seest I am pacified still.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
Nay, prithee, begone. 
                (
                Hostess
                 
                exits
                .
                )
               Now, Hal, to

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the news at court. For the robbery, lad, how is that

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: answered?

speaker: PRINCE
text: O, my sweet beef, I must still be good angel to

speaker: PRINCE
text: thee. The money is paid back again.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: O, I do not like that paying back. ’Tis a double

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: labor.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I am good friends with my father and may do

speaker: PRINCE
text: anything.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: Rob me the Exchequer the first thing thou

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: dost, and do it with unwashed hands too.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: Do, my lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text: I have procured thee, Jack, a charge of foot.

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: I would it had been of horse. Where shall I

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: find one that can steal well? O, for a fine thief of

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: the age of two-and-twenty or thereabouts! I am heinously

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: unprovided. Well, God be thanked for these

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: rebels. They offend none but the virtuous. I laud

speaker: FALSTAFF
text: them; I praise them.

speaker: PRINCE
text: Bardolph.

speaker: BARDOLPH
text: My lord.

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Go
              ,
               
              bear
               
              this
               
              letter
               
              to
               
              Lord
               
              John
               
              of
               
              Lancaster
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
To
               
              my
               
              brother
               
              John
              ;
               
              this
               
              to
               
              my
               
              Lord
               
              of
               
              Westmoreland
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Go
              ,
               
              Peto
              ,
               
              to
               
              horse
              ,
               
              to
               
              horse
              ,
               
              for
               
              thou
               
              and
               
              I

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Have
               
              thirty
               
              miles
               
              to
               
              ride
               
              yet
               
              ere
               
              dinner
               
              time
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Jack
              ,
               
              meet
               
              me
               
              tomorrow
               
              in
               
              the
               
              Temple
               
              hall

speaker: PRINCE
text:
At
               
              two
               
              o’clock
               
              in
               
              the
               
              afternoon
              ;

speaker: PRINCE
text:
There
               
              shalt
               
              thou
               
              know
               
              thy
               
              charge
              ,
               
              and
               
              there
               
              receive

speaker: PRINCE
text:
Money
               
              and
               
              order
               
              for
               
              their
               
              furniture
              .

speaker: PRINCE
text:
The
               
              land
               
              is
               
              burning
              .
               
              Percy
               
              stands
               
              on
               
              high
              ,

speaker: PRINCE
text:
And
               
              either
               
              we
               
              or
               
              they
               
              must
               
              lower
               
              lie
              .

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
Rare
               
              words
              ,
               
              brave
               
              world
              !
              —
              Hostess
              ,
               
              my
               
              breakfast
              ,
               
              come
              .
              —

speaker: FALSTAFF
text:
O
              ,
               
              I
               
              could
               
              wish
               
              this
               
              tavern
               
              were
               
              my
               
              drum
              .
